vectorData.altText: 6. Name the two portions of the small intestine that are intraperitoneal.
That's right! The jejunum and ileum are intraperitoneal organs, connected to the posterior body wall by the mesentery.
Although there is no sharp border between these two subdivisions, the jejunum largely occupies the left upper quadrant, while the ileum largely occupies the right lower quadrant.
over the costal margin to reveal the intestines.

You will not see the duodenum because, as noted previously, it is secondarily retroperitoneal. 
However, the remainder of the small intestine, the jejunum and ileum, are intraperitoneal and clearly visible.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
